speak:
King Air C90B Memory Items.
Airspeeds.
V, S, 0. 78 knots. V, S, 1. 88 knots. V, M C A . 80 knots. V, S S E . 97 Knots. V, X . 101 knots. V, X S E. 100 knots. V, Y . 112 knots. V, Y S E . 108 knots. V, glide. 125 knots. V, A, Maneuvering speed. 163 knots. V, R . 100 knots for Dash 21 powered aircraft, 94 knots for Dash 1 35A powered aircraft. V, 50 feet. 109 knots for Dash 21 powered aircraft, 111 knots for Dash 1 35A powered aircraft. V, cruise climb. 150 knots from Sea level up to 10000 feet. 130 knots from 10000 up to 20000 feet. 120 knots from 20000 up to 25000 feet. 110 knots from 25000 up to 30000 feet. V, approach, before the final approach fix. 140 knots. V, approach, after the final approach fix. 120 knots. V, approach, flaps down both engines operating. 101 knots. V, approach, one engine inoperative. 110 knots. V, approach, flap malfunction. 115 knots. V, M, O . 226 knots. M, M, O . 0.46 Mach. V, turbulence. 161 knots. V, minimum icing speed. 140 knots. V, holding. 140 knots. V, flaps extended. 184 knots for flaps approach, 148 knots for flaps down. V, L, O . 182 knots for landing gear extension, 163 knots for landing gear retraction. V, L, E. 182 knots. V, emergency descent. 182 knots. V, max effective windshield anti ice speed. 226 knots. Max crosswind. 25 knots. Airspeed indicator, white arc. 78 knots, V S 0. to 148 knots, max full flaps extended speed. Airspeed indicator, thick white arc. 78 knots, V S 0. to 88 knots, V S 1. Airspeed indicator, thin white arc. 88 knots, V S 1. to 148 knots, max full flaps extended speed. Airspeed indicator, red and white barber pole. 226 knots or 0.46 mach, whichever is lower.
Weights.
Max ramp weight. 10 5, 45 pounds. Max Takeoff weight. 10 4, 85 pounds. Max landing weight. 98, 32 pounds. Max zero fuel weight. 93, 78 pounds. Max rear and nose baggage weight. 350 pounds. Maximum takeoff weight is limited by the most restrictive of. Max takeoff weight, max takeoff weight to achieve takeoff climb requirements, or max takeoff weight as limited by takeoff speed. The last restriction does not apply to guardian flight aircraft due to a different tire type installation.
Aircraft System Limits.
De-ice boots minimum temperature. Negative 40 celsius. Maximum Outside air temperature. I S A plus 37 celsius. Minimum Altitudes for the use of the autopilot. On Approach, 200 feet. During Climb, 500 feet. All other operations, 1000 feet. Starting sequence limits. 40 Seconds on, 60 seconds off. 40 Seconds on, 60 seconds off. 40 Seconds on, 30 minutes off.
Engine Torque Limits.
Max takeoff and Continuous torque. 13, 15 foot pounds for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 15, 20 foot pounds for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft. Max Transient torque. Fifteen Hundred foot pounds for two seconds on Dash 21 equipped aircraft. No transient torque is allowed on Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft. Max reverse torque. None defined for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 15, 20 foot pounds for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft.
Engine Temperature Limits.
Max starting ITT. 10, 90 celsius for 2 seconds. Max transient ITT. 8, 25 celsius for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 6, 95 to 8, 25 for two seconds. 8, 80 celsius for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft. 8, O 5 to 8, 80 celcsius for two seconds. Max takeoff, continuous and reverse ITT. 6, 95 celsius for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 8, O 5 celsius for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft. Max low idle ITT. 6, 60 celsius for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 6, 85 celsius for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft. Max Guardian Flight Cruise ITT. 6, 80 celsius for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 7, 90 celsius for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft.
Engine Gas Generator Limits.
Max takeoff and continuous N.G. . 101.5%. Max transient N.G. . 102.6%. Max reverse N.G. . 88% for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 101.5% celsius for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft. Minimum idle N.G. . 58% for ground idle, 70% for high idle.
Engine propeller Limits.
Max Takeoff and continuous propeller RPM. 22 Hundred RPM for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 19 Hundred RPM for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft. Max reverse propeller RPM. 21 Hundred RPM for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 18, 15 RPM for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft. Transient propeller RPM. 24, 20 RPM for 5 seconds for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 20, 90 RPM for 5 seconds for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft. Minimum propeller idle RPM. 11 Hundred RPM for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 10, 70 RPM for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft. N 2, exceeding 22 hundred for Dash 21, or 19 hundred for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft, is an indication of. Primary governor failure. N 2, exceeding 22, 88 on Dash 21 equipped aircraft is an indication of. Primary and Overspeed governor failure. The overspeed governor attempts to limits propeller speed to less than 104% of the selected propeller speed. If propeller speed exceeds 106% of the selected propeller speed, the Fuel Topping Governor will limit power to keep the propeller speed at 106% or less. In the reverse range, the fuel topping governor will limit propeller speed to 95% of the selected propeller speed. It is important that the propeller levers are pushed full foward in order to achieve maximum reverse. Overspeed governor test RPM. 2000, plus or minus 60 RPM for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 17 20, plus or minus 40 RPM for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft.
Additional Engine Limits.
Oil Pressure.
Minimum oil pressure at idle. 40 PSI. Max takeoff, continuous, and reverse oil pressure. 80 to 100 PSI for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 85 to 105 PSI for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft. Transient oil pressure. 200 PSI for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. None defined for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft.
Oil Temperature.
Minimum Starting oil temperature. Negative 40 celsius. Low Idle Oil temperature range. Negative 40 to 99 celsius. High Idle Oil temperature range. 0 to 99 celsius. Takeoff and continuous oil temperature range. 10 to 99 celsius. Cruise climb, max cruise temperature range on Dash 21 equiped aircraft. 0 to 99 celsius. Max reverse oil temperature range. 0 to 99 celsius. Transient oil temperature range. 0 to 99 celsius for Dash 21 equiped aircraft. 104 celsius for 10 minutes for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft.
Oil System Specifications.
Engine oil type. Eastman 23 80. Total Oil Capacity. 14 Quarts. Undrainable Oil quantity. 1.5 quarts. Oil refill capacity. 12.5 quarts. Oil Operating range. 4 quarts low to full.
Electrical System Specifications.
Generator specifications. 28 Volts, 250 Amps. 100% Generator load N1 limits. 85% N1 minimum. Generator load and N1 limits for ground operation. 0 to 50% generator load, 59% N1 minimum. 50 to 80% generator load, 61% N1 minimum. 80 to 85% generator load, 70% N1 minimum. Inverter specifications. 2 Single Phase, 400 Hertz AC inverters at 115 and 26 Volts. Battery specifications. 24 volts, 42 amp hour, sealed led acid battery. External power requirements. 28.2 plus or minus 0.2 volts. Should be capable of 1000 Amps for 5 seconds, 500 amps for 2 minutes, and 300 amps continuously.
Fuel System.
Usable fuel capacity. 384 gallons or 2573 pounds. Fuel Capacity per side. 192 Gallons. 131 in the wing tanks, 61 in the nacelle tank Max fuel imbalance. 200 pounds. Fuel crossfeed is only permitted during. An electrical boost pump failure or an engine failure. Fuel Low, Yellow arc on fuel quantity gauge. Less than 265 pounds of fuel is left in each wing system. No takeoff permitted. Electrical Boost pump operating envelope. Both electrical boost pumps must be activated prior to engine start. In the event of an inoperative boost pump in flight. Left or Right low fuel pressure annunciator illuminated. engine operation is limited to 10 hours prior to mandatory engine-driven fuel pump replacement or overhaul. Windmilling time is not charged against this limit. Boost pumps must be operational prior to takeoff. Unavailable fuel with no fuel transfer pumps. 28 Gallons. Alternate fuel limits. Alternate fuels such as 100 Low Led may be used for 150 hours between engine overhauls. Operations are limited below 8000 feet pressure altitude with inoperative boost pumps. Cross feed capability required for flight above 8000 feet pressure altitude.
Pressurization Limits.
Max cabin differential pressure. 5.1 PSI. Cabin Altitude at max aircraft pressure altitude of 30,000. 12,000 feet.
Additional Aircraft Specifications.
Wingspan. 50 feet, 3 inches. Height. 14 feet, 3 inches. Length. 35 feet, 6 inches. Powerplant. PT6A Dash 21, or 1 35A. Max pressure altitude. 30000 feet. Max occupancy. 13 including crew. Pneumatic pressure range. Green arc, 12 to 20 PSI. Red line, 20 PSI. Gyro suction ranges. Sea level to 15000 feet, 4.3 to 5.9 inches of mercury. 15000 to 35000 feet, 2.8 to 4.3 inches of mercury. 15000 foot line, 4.3 inches of mercury. 35000 foot line, 3.0 inches of mercury. Flight load limits. Flaps up. positive 3.28, negative 1.31 G . Flaps down. positive 2.0 G, no negative Gs. Tire Specifications. Main Landing gear tire. 8 point 5 by 10, 10 ply. Nose Landing gear tire. 6 point 5 by 10, 10 ply. Tire limitations. 51 to 55 PSI for the nose landing gear tire. 70 plus or minus 3 PSI for the main landing gear tires. Rated for a max of 160 MPH. Both wing Ice lights are required per FAA A D 98, zero four, 24. This A D supersedes any relief provided by the M E L.
Power Settings
Max initial power on takeoff roll. 1,200 foot pounds for Dash 21 equiped aircraft. 1400 foot pounds for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft. Max Guardian Flight Cruise ITT. 6, 80 Celsius for Dash 21 equipped aircraft. 7, 90 Celsius for Dash 1 35A equipped aircraft.
